chapter.title: Setup Devbox
chapter.para: There are a few ways to install Murano devbox:

listitem.para: using Vagrant automation tool
or
using a script to install all components automatically

chapter.note: The preferred way is to use script for automated installation. It is described in Automated Way section below.

section.title: Vagrant Way
section.para: The simplest way to get working Murano devbox is Vagrant tool. On this page describes how to create the Murano DevBox on Ubuntu Desktop.

listitem.para: Install VirtualBox:
Install VirtualBox Extension Pack.

To install Extension Pack please go to the Dowload section on virtualbox.org (https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads), then select and download appropriate Extension Pack package. When downloaded, open it with VirtualBox (you could simply double-click the file) and install the package.
Install Vagrant:
Upgrade the Vagrant:
Clone murano-deployment repository:
Change directory to cloned repository folder:

section.programlisting: ># cd murano-deployment/getting-started ># git checkout -b release-0.4 origin/release-0.4

listitem.para: IMPORTANT STEP: RabbitMQ credentials are specified to default in murano-deployment/getting-started/localrc so don't forget to change them by replacing all the markers ‘***’ to your settings:

section.programlisting: # Lab Settings #------------- # Address of the host which provides Keystone service. # # LAB_HOST='192.168.1.2' LAB_HOST='***.***.***.***' ...

listitem.para: Launch the box:
The script will do the following:
- Download the predefined vagrnat box with Ubuntu Server 12.04;
- Register it in Vagrant;
- Start the box using vagrant.
- Vagrant will do the rest:
- Launch and initialize the box;
- Execute the provision.sh script which will install Murano onto the box.
When everything is done open the link http://127.0.0.1:8080/horizon

section.title: Automated Way
section.para: This easy way can be used on Ubuntu Server 12.04 x86-64 and CentOS 6.4 x86-64. Also, you can use virtual machines on VMWare, VirtualBox, KVM with these operating systems.

listitem.para: Create a folder to hold git repositories:
Clone murano-deployment repository from branch release-0.4:
Install prerequisites and configure devbox.
Press Enter to configure lab binding configuration file /etc/murano-deployment/lab-binding.rc

section.programlisting:
LAB_HOST=''
ADMIN_USER='' ADMIN_PASSWORD=''
RABBITMQ_LOGIN='' RABBITMQ_PASSWORD='' RABBITMQ_VHOST='' RABBITMQ_PORT=''

section.para: It's recommended to use separate vHost in RabbitMQ.
Then some additional system packages will be installed.

When everything is done login to the Dashboard using URL http://your_IP/horizon for Ubuntu and http://your_IP/dashboard for CentOS

section.title: Custom devstack script
section.para: It's just like regular devstack installation, but included all Murano services! Follow the steps below:

listitem.para: Add user stack to sudoers rules
Create folders where devstack will install all the files
Chanhe current user to "stack" and change directory to home
Clone devstack repository and checkout havana branch
listitem.programlisting: >stack$ cd >stack$ git clone https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack.git >stack$ cd devstack >stack$ git checkout stable/havana

listitem.para: Clone murano-deployment repository
Copy required files from murano-deployment to devstack, then configure local.conf. You should set at least one configuration parameter there - HOST_IP address.

Replace (or settings merge with) local.conf with another config file, if you need a different type of installation. Available config files and installation types are:
single-node.local.conf - single-node all-in-one installation. OpenStack + Murano will be installed on your node together.
devbox.local.conf - install Murano only. OpenStack must be installed on another node, and your node will be configured to use it.
Edit devstack's configuration file
From devstack directory, lauch stack.sh

section.para: Now you can operate with Openstack and Murano. Murano Dashboard panel should appears in horizon dashboard. Just open URL http:/// in web browser. Login with username admin and password swordfiwh. Open Murano tab and enjoy.
